metadata.title: CVE-2018-5345 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A stack-based buffer overflow within GNOME gcab through 0.7.4 can beexploited by malicious attackers to cause a crash or, potentially, executearbitrary code via a crafted .cab file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcab - 0.7-1ubuntu0.1
gir1.2-libgcab-1.0 - 0.7-1ubuntu0.1
libgcab-1.0-0 - 0.7-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gcab package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7-1ubuntu0.1').
